Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hospital Surgical Volume on Long-term Survival in Gastric Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: previously randomised to adjuvant chemoradiation or surgery alone

Participants.evidence: 448 surgical survivors with stage IB-IV (M0) gastric and gastroesophageal junction adenocarcinoma

Intervention.evidence: randomised to adjuvant chemoradiation or surgery alone

Objective.evidence: The study aimed to evaluate hospital surgical volume's effect on overall survival and gastric cancer recurrence

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was overall survival, assessed over a median follow-up of 8.9 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified

Result_Outcome.evidence: adjusted hazard ratio of 0.80 (95% CI, 0.53–1.20) for overall survival and 0.78 (95% CI, 0.53–1.14) for disease-free survival

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided
